name: SkylerIrvineWeekdaily
0:
”Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?”
”Alexa, play my Flash Briefing”
skdetail:
Flash Briefing Skill
This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
Daily briefings from Skyler Irvine included exclusive content not available else where. Also featuring highlight clips from interviews and conversations with the leading marketers and executives who are pushing the limits on a daily basis. 

SKYLER IRVINE MEANS BUSINESS
My name is Skyler Irvine and I am a serial entrepreneur, investor and CEO of RenzlerMedia, a full service digital marketing and media agency in Phoenix, Arizona.

I have been building businesses since I was 24 years old and was fired from my only corporate job. As a business owner, I have always been obsessed with efficiency and maximizing the value of every dollar I spend. To me, the concept of content marketing is a no brainer. I don’t believe in this strategy because I own a digital media company, I started my digital media company because of how much I believe in this strategy.

At 24, I started my first company buying foreclosed homes and turning them into occupied rentals for my own portfolio. Shortly after banks stopped lending to me so I pivoted to private hard money lending with shorter investment periods.

As the market recovered, I shifted my real estate investing business into a retail real estate company helping others buy and sell homes. Through leveraging the free tools provided by Facebook, I grew this business to $21+ Million in annual sales without an increase in my marketing budget. In 2015 I published my first book: How To Leverage Your Real Estate Business With Facebook.

In 2016, I left the real estate business and spent one full year making videos on YouTube, learning everything I could about video production in the digital world.

In January of 2017, I launched RenzlerMedia with the mission to do for other businesses what I had done building mine over the years: dominating in the areas that my competitors were overlooking rather than try and outspend in the areas they already dominated.
priv: The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
